xmlns:syn="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/modules/syndication/" xmlns="http://purl.org/rss/1.0/">             <channel rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/other-links/RSS">   <title>Other links</title> <syn:updateFrequency>1</syn:updateFrequency>             <syn:updateBase>2010-09-11T14:21:18Z</syn:updateBase>             <image rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/logo.png"/>    <items>     <rdf:Seq>                <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/biosphere-reserves"/>                       <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/bes"/>                       <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/ecological-continuity-trust"/>                       <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/expeer"/>                       <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/ground-beetles-of-ireland"/>                       <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/nature-news-views"/>                       <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/nia"/>                       <rdf:li rdf:resource="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/uk-eof"/>            </rdf:Seq>   </items>  </channel>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/biosphere-reserves">     <title>Biosphere Reserves</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/biosphere-reserves</link>     <description>Biosphere reserves are sites established by countries and recognized under UNESCO's Man and the Biosphere (MAB) Programme to promote sustainable development based on local community efforts and sound science.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:other</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2011-02-01T15:25:00Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/bes">     <title>British Ecological Society</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/bes</link>     <description>The BES  was established in 1913 and has approximately 4,000 members worldwide. Its activities include publishing a range of scientific literature, organising and sponsoring meetings, funding grant schemes, education and policy work.  It also runs supporting initiatives such as the gratis book scheme which aims to make ecology publications available to those who couldn\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdt otherwise obtain them.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:other</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2013-08-29T14:55:00Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/ecological-continuity-trust">     <title>Ecological Continuity Trust</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/ecological-continuity-trust</link>     <description>The aim of the Ecological Continuity Trust is to initiate and maintain long-term experiments that are specifically designed to help future generations understand and manage ecological change.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:other</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2011-02-01T15:10:00Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/expeer">     <title>ExpeER</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/expeer</link>     <description>ExpeER (Experimentation in Ecosystem Research) is a major European Infrastructure project (2010-2014) in the field of Ecosystem Research. ExpeER will, for the first time, federate existing national infrastructures, improve their research capacity whilst at the same time facilitating access to those key experimental and observational platforms as well as analytical and modelling facilities for the benefit of the international research community.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:featured</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>link-set:other</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2013-04-10T13:04:59Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/ground-beetles-of-ireland">     <title>Ground beetles of Ireland</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/ground-beetles-of-ireland</link>     <description>This site aims to encourage interest in Irish ground beetles. It provides illustrations of the species and distribution maps.  It is intended to act as a stimulus to further recording of ground beetles in Ireland by providing a resource which makes these little-studied animals more accessible to interested amateurs, biological recorders, school biology classes and the general public.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:other</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2011-02-01T14:30:00Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/nature-news-views">     <title>Nature and Biodiversity News & Views</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/nature-news-views</link>     <description>'News and Views' is a website by ALTER-Net and CEH which presents short topics on a range of issues concerning the natural world and invites people to voice their views.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:other</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2011-09-07T08:20:00Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/nia">     <title>Nature Improvement Areas</title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/nia</link>     <description>Nature Improvement Areas are a new name for the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdEcological Restoration Zones\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd proposed by the Making Space for Nature review. Information is currently available on the Natural England website. There are 12 NIAs in England.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:other</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2013-04-10T13:15:00Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>     <item rdf:about="http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/uk-eof">     <title>UK-Environmental Observation Framework (UK-EOF) </title>     <link>http://www.ecn.ac.uk/links/link-items/uk-eof</link>     <description>The UK-Environmental Observation Framework (UK-EOF) strives to change the way the UK perceives, values, archives and uses information from observation activities by working across public departments and agencies, the voluntary sector, industry and academia.</description>          <dc:publisher>No publisher</dc:publisher>     <dc:creator>admin</dc:creator>     <dc:rights></dc:rights>            <dc:subject>link-set:env-monitoring</dc:subject>                 <dc:subject>link-set:other</dc:subject>          <dc:date>2012-11-26T14:37:17Z</dc:date>     <dc:type>Link</dc:type>   </item>      </rdf:RDF>
